question: What is the purpose of the CTU electronic information system?
answer: The CTU electronic information system is used to record study results, assessments, and other academic activities.
answer_generated: The purpose of the CTU electronic information system is to collectively administer the Students’ Register, which serves for registration of students and for budgetary and statistical purposes. It is kept by the study departments and S&R Departments in an operative manner, and only authorized employees of CTU can enter information into it. Article(33)(1)(3)(4).
context:
Document 1: Artic le 33 
Students’  Register  
(1) Pursuant  to Section  88 of the Act, CTU keeps  a Students’  Register.   The Students’  Register  serves  
for registration  of students  and for budgetary  and statistical  purposes.  
 (2) The Students’  Register  contains  information  about  individual  students  required  by the Act and the 
Ministry.   Study and Examination  Rules for Students  at CTU 
______________ _____________________________________________________________  
 
29 (3) The Students’  Register  is part of the CTU electronic  information  system.   It is kept  by the study  
departments  and S&R Departments  in an operative  manner.   Only  authorized  employees  of CTU 
can enter  information  into the Students’  Register  and to the study  documentation.  
 (4) The Students’  Register  is collectively  administered  by the CTU electronic  information  system.
